lion.name: Lion
lion.need: I only eat meat to stay strong!
lion.fact: Lions can eat up to 40kg of meat in one meal and are known as the "King of the Jungle"!
lion.digestiveSystem: Short digestive tract optimized for processing meat quickly

rabbit.name: Rabbit
rabbit.need: I only eat plants and vegetables!
rabbit.fact: Rabbits have special bacteria in their gut that help them digest tough plant fibers!
rabbit.habitat: Fields, meadows, and forest edges worldwide
rabbit.digestiveSystem: Long intestines and special cecum for fermenting plant matter

bear.name: Bear
bear.need: I eat both plants and meat!
bear.fact: Bears can gain up to 200kg before hibernation by eating both berries and salmon!
bear.digestiveSystem: Flexible digestive system that can process both plants and meat

eagle.name: Eagle
eagle.need: I hunt for meat and fish!
eagle.fact: Eagles have incredible eyesight - 8 times sharper than humans for spotting prey!
eagle.habitat: Mountains, coasts, and near large bodies of water
eagle.digestiveSystem: Strong stomach acids to digest bones and tough meat

cow.name: Cow
cow.need: I love eating grass and plants!
cow.fact: Cows have 4 stomach chambers and chew their food twice to digest grass properly!
cow.digestiveSystem: Four-chambered stomach system for breaking down cellulose

pig.name: Pig
pig.need: I enjoy both plants and other foods!
pig.fact: Pigs are incredibly smart - they can learn their names and solve puzzles!
pig.digestiveSystem: Single-chambered stomach similar to humans, processing varied diet

meat.fact: Red meat is rich in protein and iron, essential for muscle development and energy!
meat.habitat: Processed from livestock like cattle and sheep

fish.fact: Fish is an excellent source of omega-3 fatty acids, great for brain health!
fish.habitat: Found in oceans, rivers, and lakes worldwide

chicken.fact: Chicken is lean protein that helps build strong muscles and bones!
chicken.habitat: Domesticated birds raised on farms globally

worms.fact: Earthworms are 82% protein and help improve soil quality as they move!
worms.habitat: Found in moist soil and decomposing organic matter

insects.fact: Insects are eaten by 2 billion people worldwide and are very nutritious!
insects.habitat: Found everywhere on Earth except deep oceans

grass.fact: Grass contains cellulose which only herbivores can properly digest!
grass.habitat: Grows in meadows, lawns, and grasslands globally

leaves.fact: Leaves contain chlorophyll and provide vitamins and minerals!
leaves.habitat: Found on trees and plants in forests and gardens

fruits.fact: Fruits are packed with vitamins, especially vitamin C for immunity!
fruits.habitat: Grow on trees and bushes in orchards and wild areas

seeds.fact: Seeds contain all nutrients needed to grow into new plants!
seeds.habitat: Found inside fruits or produced by flowering plants

carrots.fact: Carrots are rich in beta-carotene which helps improve eyesight!
carrots.habitat: Root vegetables grown underground in gardens and farms

corn.fact: Corn provides energy through carbohydrates and is grown worldwide!
corn.habitat: Tall grass plant cultivated in fields across the globe

berries.fact: Berries are antioxidant powerhouses that fight harmful free radicals!
berries.habitat: Grow on bushes in forests, gardens, and wild areas
